personal.name: Emmanuel Awotwe
personal.title: AI/RAG Developer & Data Analyst (Graduate)
personal.summary: Graduate data analyst who shipped a production-quality RAG assistant in 4 weeks and improved finance/advisory delivery with measurable outcomes. Combines finance analytics with applied AI, delivering automated solutions that save significant operational time.
personal.elevator_pitch: I combine finance analytics and applied AI. In four weeks I built a grounded Food RAG MVP, migrated it to a cloud stack with an Admin Dashboard, and delivered ~1,200 hours/year in saved effort. Earlier, I supported month-end reporting at Newmont with ≥95% on-time delivery and a 20% improvement in vendor compensation turnaround; and at De Rigglets I reduced advisory turnaround ~20% with ≥85% first-pass acceptance.

salary_location.remote_experience: Experience with remote collaboration and delivery
salary_location.work_authorization: Currently on student visa, applying for working visa after Masters completion in November 2025

projects_star_format.situation: Manual content lookup and fragmented knowledge slowed support and decision-making for a food-focused program.
projects_star_format.task: Design and ship a grounded RAG system with admin surface and reliable retrieval.
projects_star_format.action: Prototyped UI (V0), wrote user stories in ClickUp, built embeddings with Ollama, configured Upstash Vector, integrated Groq API, and deployed to Vercel; implemented admin/dashboard guardrails.
projects_star_format.result: Automated information lookup saving ~1,200 hrs/year; stable production deployment with clear handover.

projects_star_format.situation: Stakeholders needed clear visibility into long-run export/import dynamics and category/subcategory drivers.
projects_star_format.task: Build executive-ready dashboards and a storyboard highlighting key trends and recommendations.
projects_star_format.action: Modeled 9 main categories and key subcategories, created Raw/Analytical/Statistical views, and a 5-point storyboard; deep-dived on 28. Metalliferous ores & metal scrap.
projects_star_format.result: Surfaced that Metalliferous ores peaked ≈$185.26B (2021), ~95% of ‘Crude Materials’ and ~31% of national exports in 2021; provided 2025–2029 recommendations (value-add processing, partner diversification, infra/logistics).

projects_star_format.situation: Fans and analysts wanted interpretable visuals on who wins, when, and how dominance evolves over time.
projects_star_format.task: Design Tableau visuals to explain win ratios, early-set dominance, and national representation.
projects_star_format.action: Built parallel coordinates, geo/treemap, scatter panels, and ‘Top Players 5+’ comparisons.
projects_star_format.result: Showed early-set dominance; men’s competitiveness rising; historical title leaders: Australia (94), USA (44); conversion: Djokovic 10/10, Court 10/11.

projects_star_format.project_name: Deep Credit Risk (PD) Modelling with Scenario Context
projects_star_format.situation: Institution required PD modelling with robust drivers and regulatory awareness.
projects_star_format.task: Compare models, quantify improvements, and frame climate/ethical constraints.
projects_star_format.action: Used Statsmodels/Logit on FICO_orig_time, LTV_orig_time, growth; discussed GDPR/explainability (SHAP concepts) and NGFS-like scenario extensions.
projects_star_format.result: Improved pseudo-R² to ~0.02535 (from ~0.01627 baseline) with better log-likelihood; articulated compliance/evaluation plan.

projects_star_format.situation: HR leaders sought drivers of performance and actionable improvements.
projects_star_format.task: Run EDA, build predictive models, and synthesize prescriptions.
projects_star_format.action: Built linear/tree regressors; analyzed rotation, training/tools, overtime; generated department insights.
projects_star_format.result: Identified factors positively/negatively associated with performance; supported targeted training and workload balance.

projects_star_format.situation: Community organization needed reliable relational design and governance.
projects_star_format.task: Produce ERD, enforce integrity, and support analytic queries.
projects_star_format.action: Implemented PK/FK with cascades, CHECK constraints, and views; wrote natural/self-joins, group-by/having, and subqueries.
projects_star_format.result: Robust schema with auditable constraints and reusable views for ops/analytics.

projects_star_format.project_name: Tesla Stock Price Forecasting (LR vs LSTM)
projects_star_format.situation: Volatile time series required benchmarkable forecasting and error analysis.
projects_star_format.task: Compare interpretable baseline vs. deep model and discuss trade-offs.
projects_star_format.action: Engineered features, trained LR and LSTM, and evaluated with RMSE/MAE/MSE/R²; plotted residuals and loss curves.
projects_star_format.result: Clear interpretability–accuracy trade-offs; guidance on when to prefer LR vs LSTM under constraints.

projects_star_format.project_name: Motor Vehicle Insurance Premium Pricing Model (Regression)
projects_star_format.situation: Motor vehicle insurers faced challenges in competitive pricing while maintaining profitability due to heterogeneous risk drivers, inconsistent rating channels, and manual pricing processes requiring accurate, explainable, and scalable premium prediction.
projects_star_format.task: Develop ML regression models to accurately predict net premium amounts based on customer, vehicle, policy, and claims data while maintaining interpretability and addressing pricing governance requirements.
projects_star_format.action: Removed PII and engineered features (driver_age_years, license_tenure_years, vehicle_age_years) from dates; median/mode-imputed missing values; standardized and one-hot encoded features; built and evaluated Dummy Regressor baseline, Ridge Regression (α=0.1), Lasso Regression, and KNN Regression using consistent preprocessing pipelines; assessed models using Mean Absolute Error (MAE) for interpretability.
projects_star_format.result: Ridge Regression champion model achieved validation MAE ~127.95 and test MAE ~216.43, representing ~13% validation error reduction and ~7% test improvement over baseline; demonstrated how ML-based pricing reduces mispricing and improves retention; proposed assistive deployment with human-validated pricing, MAE tracking, drift alerts, and fairness audits.
governance_considerations: Explainable linear models for regulatory compliance
Drift monitoring and model calibration frameworks

projects_star_format.project_name: Credit Risk Classification Model for Banking Customers (Classification)
projects_star_format.situation: Traditional rule-based credit assessment systems in banking were limited by bias and rigidity. The bank needed automated classification of customers into Good, Standard, and Poor credit-rating categories to enhance accuracy, fairness, and interpretability in loan approvals, pricing, and retention decisions.
projects_star_format.task: Build ML classification models to categorize ~48 financial and behavioral variables (repayment history, capacity, leverage, utilization, credit history depth) into credit ratings while addressing moderate class imbalance (Standard: 53%, Poor: 29%, Good: 18%) and maintaining ethical governance.
projects_star_format.action: Removed PII and unstable fields to prevent leakage; performed median imputation and ordinal/one-hot encoding; grouped features by mechanism (delinquency, capacity, utilization); used stratified splits to preserve class proportions; progressively experimented with Dummy Classifier baseline (accuracy ≈0.53, macro-F1 ≈0.37), Decision Tree, Random Forest (rf8 champion), Extra Trees, and Tuned Random Forest; evaluated using Accuracy, Precision, Recall, Macro/Weighted F1-score; conducted feature-importance analysis.
projects_star_format.result: Random Forest (rf8) champion model achieved accuracy ≈0.71 and F1 ≈0.72, representing ~18-point accuracy uplift and nearly doubled macro-F1 vs baseline; identified delinquency and credit-utilization as strongest predictors; reduced critical misclassifications (Poor as Good) significantly; projected 5–8% reduction in misclassification losses; deemed production-ready for pilot deployment with monitoring dashboards tracking accuracy drift, class recall, and fairness metrics.
governance_considerations: Exclusion of sensitive demographic attributes for fairness
Production monitoring for accuracy drift and class-specific recall

leadership_examples_star.situation: Multiple MSc team projects required direction, consistent quality, and deadlines.
leadership_examples_star.task: Coordinate planning, set standards, and ensure delivery.
leadership_examples_star.action: Defined templates, split work via ClickUp, ran reviews, and handled stakeholder comms.
leadership_examples_star.result: On-time submissions with improved first-pass quality; repeatable workflow for future teams.

leadership_examples_star.situation: Production RAG launch needed smooth cross-functional execution.
leadership_examples_star.action: Gathered requirements, synced CMS across UAT/Prod, unblocked developers, and owned QA/hand-off.
leadership_examples_star.result: Stable launch with measurable time-savings (~1,200 hrs/yr).

experience.title: Business & AI/RAG Data Analyst Intern
experience.company_context: AI/ML consulting firm specializing in business analytics and industry projects
experience.team_structure: Cross-functional team including developers, technical staff, and analysts
experience.project: Employability Advantage Live Industry Project (20 weeks total: 10 weeks as Business Analyst + 10 weeks as AI Data Analyst)

responsibilities: Practiced Scrum methodology across Scrum/Kanban workflows; ran sprint planning, estimates, and Agile ceremonies (stand-ups, reviews, retros)
Wrote high-quality User Stories (EPICs/Stories/Tasks/Defects) using INVEST, SMART, and SCQA frameworks; refined acceptance criteria with MoSCoW prioritisation
Set up Jira projects (boards, backlogs, sprints, dashboards) and Confluence spaces for requirements and traceability; documented expected UI behaviour with clear UI vocabulary
Leveraged GitHub Copilot/ChatGPT to draft, critique and tighten stories & acceptance criteria; facilitated requirements management (user-centric vs system-centric)
Built analytics workflows in Python + SQL; automated data pipelines and APIs with AWS Lambda + API Gateway; managed AWS RDS PostgreSQL (via pgAdmin)
Performed data analysis/visualisation with pandas and Matplotlib; engineered REST API integrations for ingestion & enrichment
Applied Generative AI (AWS Bedrock / Anthropic) to create synthetic data for testing and scenario design; used GitHub Copilot to accelerate implementation and reviews

achievements_star.situation: 20-week Employability Advantage Live Industry Project at AUSBIZ Consulting required delivering production-grade Business Analysis artifacts (first 10 weeks) followed by AI-powered data solutions including RAG systems and a Digital Twin (second 10 weeks).
achievements_star.task: Execute full Agile/Scrum BA workflows in the first phase, then transition to building automated data pipelines with AWS services, applying Generative AI for testing, and shipping production-ready RAG applications with semantic search capabilities in the second phase.
achievements_star.action: First 10 weeks as Business Analyst: Practiced Scrum methodology running sprint planning and Agile ceremonies; wrote User Stories using INVEST/SMART/SCQA frameworks with MoSCoW prioritisation; set up Jira projects and Confluence spaces; leveraged GitHub Copilot/ChatGPT for story refinement. Second 10 weeks as AI Data Analyst: Built Python+SQL analytics workflows; automated pipelines with AWS Lambda, API Gateway, and RDS PostgreSQL; performed data analysis with pandas/Matplotlib; engineered REST API integrations; applied AWS Bedrock/Anthropic for synthetic data; created embeddings with Ollama; built Food RAG app using v0.dev; deployed MCP server on Vercel; delivered Digital Twin RAG app with real-time Q&A.
achievements_star.result: Shipped production-grade RAG solutions saving ~1,200 hours/year; delivered Food RAG App (https://v0-rag-with-groq.vercel.app/) and Digital Twin RAG App (https://v0-digital-twin-rag-app.vercel.app/) with semantic, contextual answers; successfully deployed MCP server on Vercel powering real-time Q&A; demonstrated proficiency in Agile BA practices, requirements management, AWS data engineering, and Generative AI applications across both sequential phases.
